description: Best practices for building SwiftUI apps, including optimizing performance, structuring views efficiently, managing state, and ensuring smooth animations for a better user experience.
An in-depth introduction to the Combine framework for reactive programming in Swift, covering how to work with publishers, subscribers, operators, and handling asynchronous data streams efficiently.
Understanding concurrency in Swift, including async/await, Task, actors, Grand Central Dispatch (GCD), and best practices for writing thread-safe and high-performance asynchronous code.
Exploring different data persistence techniques in Swift, from lightweight storage using UserDefaults and Codable to more complex solutions like Core Data and the new SwiftData framework.

A deep dive into networking with URLSession, covering best practices for handling REST API calls, parsing JSON responses, handling authentication, and ensuring network reliability in Swift applications.
Implementing dependency injection in Swift to create modular, testable, and maintainable codebases, using techniques such as protocol-oriented programming and dependency container frameworks.
Mastering Core Data in SwiftUI, including setting up the Core Data stack, working with managed objects, handling migrations, and integrating Core Data seamlessly with SwiftUI views.
A complete guide to unit testing in Swift, covering XCTest, test-driven development (TDD), mocking dependencies, UI testing, and strategies for writing robust, maintainable tests.
